seo.title: Model Conferences Slovakia — Home
seo.description: MCS organizes model conferences for high school and university students.

hero.title: Model Conferences for Future Leaders and Diplomats of Slovakia
hero.desc: Experience diplomacy firsthand. At model conferences for high school and university students, you get to develop essential skills such as critical thinking, public speaking skills, and the ability to lead with respect.

about.title: What is MCS?
about.desc: Model Conferences Slovakia (MCS) is a non-profit organization that shapes future leaders and diplomats. Through model conferences, we allow the youth to develop crucial skills such as critical thinking, public speaking, as well as global awareness.

projects.title: Projects
projects.sampleDesc1: NATOBA is the pilot project of MCS. It is an international simulation of a NATO summit in Bratislava...
projects.sampleDesc2: MUN 2025 is a prestigious conference simulating the activities of the UN...
projects.sampleDesc3: MUN 2026 will continue the tradition of providing a platform for young leaders...

partnerCta.title: Support Young Leaders
partnerCta.desc: Do you believe in the value of education and the potential of young people? Support MCS and become a part of the projects that develop the leaders of tomorrow from all over the world.

volunteerCta.title: Join Us
volunteerCta.desc: Do you want to explore conferences, grow as a leader, and join a dedicated team? Become a volunteer at MCS and help develop the future leaders of the world.
volunteerCta.desc2: Become part of a community of young leaders, diplomats, and visionaries. Whether as a volunteer or an organizer, you will get to undergo meaningful experiences, new challenges, and have room for growth. Join us and be a part of real change.

hero.title: Students Shaping the Future Through Dialogue
hero.desc: We are a community of young leaders, who, through simulations of international institutions, develop diplomacy, critical thinking, and the courage to lead, connecting students from across the globe to address global challenges here and today.

board.title: Board of Trustees
board.desc: The Board of Trustees is the highest body of MCS. It consists of three members including the president of the board. It handles legal matters, approves accounting, the annual report, statute changes, and oversees the organization’s development.

executiveBoard.title: Executive Board
executiveBoard.desc: The Executive Board has five members and oversees the Director, MCS strategy, and activity planning. It issues regulations and adjusts internal rules.

director.title: Director
director.desc: The Director manages the daily operations of MCS, coordinates projects, and represents the organization externally.

auditor.title: Auditor
auditor.desc: The Auditor supervises the financial and administrative correctness of MCS operations.

sectionLeaders.title: Section Leaders
sectionLeaders.desc: Six Section Leaders ensure running key areas of preparation and implementation of MCS projects.

volunteers.title: Volunteers
volunteers.desc: A team of 50 young enthusiasts organize events and spread awareness of diplomacy among youth at home and abroad.

criticalThinking.title: Critical Thinking and Debate Skills
criticalThinking.desc: MCS supports the development of analytical and logical thinking as well as the ability to formulate and defend one’s views.

activeCitizenship.title: Active Citizenship and Engagement
activeCitizenship.desc: We prepare young people for active participation in society and motivate them to help solve issues on a local, national, and global level.

dialogueUnderstanding.title: Dialogue and Understanding
dialogueUnderstanding.desc: We believe in the power of respectful, active dialogue as a tool for creating consensus among different views and interests.

personalGrowth.title: Personal Growth and Self‑Expression
personalGrowth.desc: MCS creates a safe space to build confidence, express oneself, and present ideas without fear.

globalChallengesEducation.title: Education on Global Challenges
globalChallengesEducation.desc: An important value to our organisation is raising awareness of international relations, diplomacy, and today’s global challenges.

creativitySolutions.title: Creativity and Problem‑Solving
creativitySolutions.desc: We encourage young people to be proactive and seek innovative, constructive solutions to the world’s problems.

adam.desc: Adam (16) studies at the bilingual Jur Hronec Grammar School in Bratislava. Having the privilege of growing up in Taiwan and Moldova, these experiences shaped his interest in diplomacy. He actively participates in MUN, MEP, debates, and moot courts. By establishing this initiative, he aims to nurture critical thinking and inspire a deeper engagement with international affairs among students all over the globe.

hana.desc: Hana studies international law at the Amsterdam University College. She has attended dozens of model conferences, while also helping organize many of them. She partakes in the Duke of Edinburgh International Award and works with the youth. At MCS she aspires to make these experiences accessible to others and support further education about diplomacy.

hero.title: Support the Education and Growth of Future Leaders
hero.desc: Help us develop critical thinking, public speaking, and civic engagement among students globally. Whether you’re an individual or a company, your support matters.

leaders.title: Educating Future Leaders
leaders.desc: Your support helps shape a generation of young people who want to influence the world around them and engage with it in a responsible manner.

impact.title: Real Social Impact
impact.desc: MCS conferences and programmes build skills that young people use in school, work, and public life.

criticalThinkingDialogue.title: Supporting Critical Thinking and Dialogue
criticalThinkingDialogue.desc: You invest in skills that build an open, tolerant, and informed society.

transparencyNonprofit.title: Transparent, Non‑Profit Organization
transparencyNonprofit.desc: Every euro goes directly to educational activities, with no profit for the founders or leadership. We are open and accountable to donors and partners.

partnershipValue.title: Partnership with Long‑Term Value
partnershipValue.desc: We offer companies meaningful collaboration, visibility, and a chance to strengthen civil society.

communityChange.title: A Community Driven by Change
communityChange.desc: You get to join people who care about the world’s future. Become educated, engaged, and ready to act.

taxDonate.title: Donate 2% of Your Taxes
taxDonate.desc: Decide where a part of your taxes go. Support the education and growth of young leaders.

points.0: Just fill in the government 2% form
points.2: Submit to the tax office or to your employer. Don’t miss the end-of-April deadline.

taxDonate.paragraph: Decide where a part of your taxes go. Support the education and growth of young leaders.

oneTimeDonation.title: One‑Time Donation
oneTimeDonation.desc: Even a one‑time contribution makes a difference. Support us via a bank transfer.

points.1: Helps young people who want to grow

recurringSupport.desc: A small monthly contribution = a big difference.

transparency.title: We Act Transparently and Responsibly
transparency.desc: We believe that trust is built through action. We publish all key documents, regularly evaluate our activities, and direct every euro to where it has the greatest impact, which means investing it into the education and development of young people.

cta.title: Become a Partner
cta.desc: Become a partner of Model Conferences Slovakia and help us develop critical thinking, dialogue, and civic engagement among youth. Your support is an investment in education, values, and the future of Slovakia. Together we can shape a generation that will change the world.

contactsPage.title: Contact
contactsPage.description: Do you have questions or want to collaborate? Contact us through the form or in other ways, we'll be happy to respond.
